results.title: At the threshold
results.creator_credit: Michael Grant, Richard Meech and Biniman Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Millennium: tribal wisdom and the modern world”.
Has the pursuit of self interest that has driven our society since the 12th Century finally run its course? Explore this possibility in the series finale. Return with David Maybury-Lewis to tribes all over the world to review the primary wisdom’s that tribal people offer to our modernised world. Then travel to central France to explore the most perplexing dilemmas of the western world. heart versus mind, body versus soul, the desires of the individual versus the needs of society. Visit a rural French family whose lifestyle exhibits the positive influences that have been inherited from a tribal past. Understand why our survival as a species may now depend on rediscovering the wisdom’s of our tribal past.

results.title: At the supermarket
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Non-narrated. Shows us some of the people who help run a supermarket. Apart from the familiar helpers such as checkout cashiers, and sales assistants we also see people who prepare meat and vegetables for sale, those who order and take delivery of stock and night fillers.

results.title: At the spring sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, ONF | NFB and Quentin Brown
results.brief_description: Netsilik Inuit Eskimo families travel across the sea ice. Before night falls, they build igloos. A boy practices spear throwing at a figure built in the snow while a woman crimps the sole of a sealskin boot.

results.title: At the spare time
results.creator_credit: Film Studio of the Peoples Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China Today”.
Focuses on the many leisure activities of Chinese workers and professionals. Cultural and artistic pursuits are an important part of the workers’ lifestyle.

results.title: At the sign of the owl
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Herschells Films and Colin Dean
results.brief_description: Surveys the activities of the Council of Adult Education in organising cultural activities throughout Victoria, showing particularly the annual Summer School conducted at Albury. The school extends over ten days and provides opportunities for the study of art and crafts, music, opera and drama.

results.title: At the front: 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Annice Vass and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of Cinesound and Movietone Newsreels featuring footage from World War II including Prime Minister Robert Menzies’ declaration of war in 1939, the AIF at Benghazi, the Coral Sea Victory, the Australian Women’s Army Service and other momentous events including famous war footage shot by Damian Parer.

results.title: At the foot of Mt Fuji
results.brief_description: A day in the life of a ten year old child who lives in a small town at the base of Mt Fuji in Japan, is revealed in his letter to a pen pal in the United States. Suitable for Early-Middle Primary students. No other credits available.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Birdlife on Townsville Common, showing the osprey, kite, plover, jabiru stork, egret, spoonbill, and heron. Concentrates on the Australian crane, the brolga and in particular its courtship dance,

results.title: At the crossroads: the story of America's endangered species
results.creator_credit: Stouffer Productions, Mark Stouffer and Marty Stouffer
results.brief_description: Much of America’s wildlife is now endangered because of hunting, trapping, poisoning, habitat destruction and environmental pollution. America’s extinct mammals and birds include the Gull Island Vole, the Plains Wolf, the Sea Mink, the Labrador Duck and the Great Auk. the Whooping Crane are a dramatic example of an endangered species which came back form the brink of extinction. A simple alternative is offered and some important reasons why these endangered species are vitally important to all life on Earth are presented. Includes footage of the Ivory-billed Woodpecker which was last filmed in 1935 and is probably now extinct. Narrated by Barton Heyman.
results.title_for_label: At the crossroads: the story of America’s endangered species
